name: Marc Antonelli
subtitle: Financial Services Office, Client Executive & Tax Service Line Markets Leader
about: I'm currently an Associate Director at EY supporting our Tax Service Line in the Financial Services Office. I also serve as the Client Executive for a Category IV Banking client. Previously, I spent 6 years with Deloitte in a variety of roles supporting their Human Capital and Human Capital as a Service offerings.I have 15+ years of experience working with clients across industries, but most recently focused on Financial Services. My top priority is to understand the needs of my clients and advise them on possible solutions to meet their desired outcomes.
experiences: Financial Services Office, Tax Service Line Markets Leader & Client Executive (Banking)
Senior Manager, Sales Executive, Human Capital as a Service

Financial Services & Insurance Leader for Human Capital as a Service. Assisted my clients with their most-challenging HR & Talent needs in Talent Acquisition, Talent Management, L&D, Total Rewards, HR Tech, and People Analytics.
Senior Manager, US Sales Leader, Human Capital Research & Sensing

Managed the US Research & Sensing team, covering all of Deloitte's industries: Consumer, Energy, Resources, & Industrials, Financial Services & Insurance, Life Sciences & Healthcare, and Technology, Media, & Telecom.
Consumer Industry Leader for Deloitte's Human Capital Research & Sensing membership. Working closely with HR executives to demonstrate the value of HR research and advisory as a subscription product.
Contingent Workforce Management & Vendor Management - providing visibility of the cost, quality, and timeliness of your contingent workforce.
Managed IT Staffing service with Dell Services, formerly Perot Systems, Federal Reserve Bank, FRIT, and other local accounts.

98% of US multinational respondents of the 2023 EY Tax and Finance Operations Survey stated that they were more likely than not to co-source in the next 24 months — in 2020, this number was only 76%.  If done well, I believe that there’s a lot of potential to unlock here, from creating efficiencies on tax compliance tasks, stabilizing IT expenses, and improving security and transparency to freeing up internal resources for core business activities and vital strategic needs — and generally paving the way for a sustainable modernization of tax activities.For more strategic opportunities to modernizing the tax function, check the article below: https://lnkd.in/e5K4Egcv  hashtag#FutureOfTax hashtag#TaxTransformation
